storyTitle: As Approver, I want to review schedule change requests to achieve informed decision making

testCases.title: Validate display of pending schedule change requests
preconditions: User has valid Approver role credentials
At least 5 pending schedule change requests exist in the system
Schedule change requests have various dates and requesters
Test environment is accessible and database is populated
Browser is supported (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter valid Approver credentials (username and password), then click Login button
steps.expectedResult: System authenticates successfully and displays the Approver dashboard with a list of pending schedule change requests visible on the main panel

steps.action: Locate the filter section and select a specific date range from the date picker, then select a specific requester name from the requester dropdown filter
steps.expectedResult: The pending requests list automatically refreshes and displays only the schedule change requests that match the selected date range and requester criteria. Request count updates to reflect filtered results

steps.action: Click on one of the filtered schedule change requests from the list to open the detailed view
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the detailed view page showing complete request information including requester name, requested dates, reason for change, current schedule, proposed schedule, submission date, priority level, and all attached documents with download links

postconditions: User remains logged in as Approver
Detailed view of selected request is displayed
All filters remain applied to the request list
No data has been modified in the system

testCases.title: Verify adding comments to schedule change requests
preconditions: User is logged in with valid Approver credentials
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
User has permission to add comments to requests
Network connection is stable

steps.action: From the pending requests list on the dashboard, click on a specific schedule change request to open its detail view
steps.expectedResult: Request detail page loads successfully displaying all request information, attachments, and a comments section with a text input field and Submit button

steps.action: Scroll to the comments section, click in the comment text field, type a test comment 'Please provide additional justification for this schedule change', and click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System displays a success message confirming comment submission. The new comment appears in the request history section with the approver's name, timestamp, and comment text. Comment text field is cleared and ready for new input

steps.action: Click the browser refresh button or navigate away from the request and then reopen the same schedule change request detail view
steps.expectedResult: The request detail page reloads and the previously added comment 'Please provide additional justification for this schedule change' is still visible in the request history with correct approver name and timestamp

postconditions: Comment is permanently saved in the database
Request history shows the new comment entry
Request status remains unchanged
Audit log contains entry for comment addition

testCases.title: Ensure request list loads within performance requirements
preconditions: User has valid Approver credentials
System has at least 50 pending schedule change requests for realistic load testing
Test environment is under normal load conditions
Browser developer tools or performance monitoring tool is available
Network latency is within normal parameters

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab to monitor load times. Navigate to the application login page, enter valid Approver credentials, and click Login
steps.expectedResult: System successfully authenticates and displays the Approver dashboard with the pending requests list fully loaded and visible

steps.action: In the browser developer tools Network tab, locate the API call for loading pending requests (GET /api/schedule-changes/pending) and check the response time from request initiation to complete page render
steps.expectedResult: The pending requests list loads completely within 3 seconds. All request entries are visible with basic information (requester, date, status). Network tab shows API response time is under 3 seconds

steps.action: Apply multiple filters by selecting a date range, choosing a specific requester, and selecting 'Pending' status. Monitor the Network tab for the filtered API call response time
steps.expectedResult: The filtered request list updates and displays only matching results within 3 seconds. Network tab confirms the filtered API call completes within the 3-second performance requirement. UI remains responsive during filtering

postconditions: Dashboard displays filtered results
System performance meets SLA requirements
No performance degradation observed
All requests are accurately displayed

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to approve or reject schedule change requests to ensure proper authorization

testCases.title: Validate approval of schedule change request
preconditions: User is logged in with valid Approver role credentials
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
User has approval permissions for the selected request
Audit logging system is enabled and functioning
Database connection is active

steps.action: From the Approver dashboard, locate a pending schedule change request in the list and click on it to open the detailed view
steps.expectedResult: Request detail page opens displaying all request information including requester details, schedule change details, attachments, and action buttons (Approve, Reject, Request More Info) are visible and enabled

steps.action: Review the request details, then click the 'Approve' button. If a confirmation dialog appears, click 'Confirm' to proceed with the approval
steps.expectedResult: System processes the approval action and displays a success confirmation message 'Schedule change request has been approved successfully'. The request status indicator changes from 'Pending' to 'Approved'. Action buttons become disabled or hidden

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log section or admin panel, search for audit entries related to this specific request ID, and verify the approval action is logged
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays a new entry showing the approval action with complete details: approver username, exact timestamp of approval, action type 'APPROVED', request ID, and any comments entered. Log entry is immutable and properly formatted

postconditions: Request status is permanently changed to 'Approved'
Audit log contains complete approval record
Requester receives notification of approval (out of scope to verify)
Request is removed from pending list
Schedule change is authorized for implementation

testCases.title: Verify rejection requires comments
preconditions: User is logged in with valid Approver credentials
At least one pending schedule change request exists
User has rejection permissions
Form validation is enabled on the rejection workflow

steps.action: From the Approver dashboard, click on a pending schedule change request to open its detailed view
steps.expectedResult: Request detail page loads successfully showing all request information and action buttons including 'Approve', 'Reject', and 'Request More Info' buttons are visible and enabled

steps.action: Click the 'Reject' button without entering any text in the comments field. Attempt to submit the rejection
steps.expectedResult: System prevents the submission and displays a validation error message 'Comments are required when rejecting a request' or similar. The comment field is highlighted in red or with an error indicator. Request status remains 'Pending' and no changes are saved

steps.action: In the comments field, enter a detailed rejection reason 'This schedule change conflicts with project deadlines and resource availability', then click the 'Reject' button and confirm if prompted
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the rejection with comments and displays success message 'Schedule change request has been rejected'. Request status updates to 'Rejected'. Audit log is created with rejection action, approver details, timestamp, and the entered comments. The rejection reason is visible in the request history

postconditions: Request status is changed to 'Rejected'
Rejection comments are permanently stored
Audit log contains complete rejection record with comments
Request is removed from pending list
Requester receives rejection notification with comments

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users cannot approve requests
preconditions: Test user account exists without Approver role permissions
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
Role-based access control is properly configured
API security middleware is active
Audit logging is enabled

steps.action: Log in to the application using credentials for a user account that does not have Approver role permissions (e.g., regular employee or requester role)
steps.expectedResult: System authenticates the user successfully but displays a dashboard appropriate for their role. Approval-related menu items, buttons, or sections are not visible. If the user navigates to schedule changes, they can only view their own requests without any approval action buttons

steps.action: Using an API testing tool (Postman, cURL, or browser console), attempt to directly call the approval API endpoint POST /api/schedule-changes/{valid-request-id}/approval with the unauthorized user's authentication token and approval action payload
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized error response with message 'Access denied: Insufficient permissions to perform approval actions' or similar. No changes are made to the request status in the database

steps.action: Log in as an administrator or user with audit log access, navigate to the audit log section, and search for any approval action entries associated with the unauthorized user account for the time period of the attempted access
steps.expectedResult: Audit log shows no approval action entries for the unauthorized user. Optionally, security log may contain an entry for the unauthorized access attempt showing the user, timestamp, attempted action, and denial reason. No successful approval actions are recorded for this user

postconditions: Request status remains unchanged
No unauthorized approval actions are logged
System security integrity is maintained
Unauthorized user remains unable to access approval functions
Security logs may contain access denial records

storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to configure approval routing rules to achieve flexible workflow management

testCases.title: Validate creation and saving of routing rules
preconditions: User has System Administrator role and valid credentials
ApprovalRoutingRules table is accessible and operational
Routing rules management interface is deployed and functional
At least one department and approver exist in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter valid System Administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: System authenticates successfully and redirects to administrator dashboard

steps.action: Click on 'Routing Rules Management' menu option from the navigation panel
steps.expectedResult: Routing rules management page loads displaying existing rules list and 'Create New Rule' button

steps.action: Click 'Create New Rule' button to open the rule creation form
steps.expectedResult: Rule creation form displays with fields for rule name, conditions, and approver assignments

steps.action: Enter rule name 'Engineering Department Routing', select condition 'Department equals Engineering', and assign approver 'John Smith'
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept input without errors and display entered values correctly

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to submit the new routing rule
steps.expectedResult: System validates the rule, saves it to ApprovalRoutingRules table, and displays success confirmation message 'Routing rule created successfully'

steps.action: Navigate to the active rules list view
steps.expectedResult: New rule 'Engineering Department Routing' appears in the active rules list with status 'Active' and correct configuration details

steps.action: Verify the rule details by clicking on the rule name
steps.expectedResult: Rule details page displays showing all configured conditions and assigned approvers matching the created rule

postconditions: New routing rule is saved in ApprovalRoutingRules table
Rule is active and available for routing schedule change requests
Rule appears in the active rules list for all administrators
System audit log contains entry for rule creation

testCases.title: Verify validation prevents conflicting routing rules
preconditions: User is logged in as System Administrator
At least one active routing rule exists for 'Department equals Engineering' with approver 'John Smith'
Routing rules management page is accessible
Rule conflict validation logic is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to Routing Rules Management page and click 'Create New Rule' button
steps.expectedResult: Rule creation form opens with empty fields ready for input

steps.action: Enter rule name 'Duplicate Engineering Rule' and configure condition 'Department equals Engineering' with approver 'Jane Doe'
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the input and displays all entered values

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to attempt saving the conflicting rule
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict with existing rule and displays error message 'Conflict detected: A routing rule already exists for Department equals Engineering. Please modify conditions or deactivate the existing rule.'

steps.action: Verify the rule was not saved by checking the active rules list
steps.expectedResult: The conflicting rule 'Duplicate Engineering Rule' does not appear in the active rules list

steps.action: Modify the rule condition to 'Department equals Engineering AND Request Type equals Shift Swap' to resolve the conflict
steps.expectedResult: Form updates with the new condition and no validation errors are displayed

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to save the modified rule
steps.expectedResult: System validates successfully, saves the rule, and displays confirmation message 'Routing rule created successfully'

steps.action: Verify the modified rule appears in the active rules list
steps.expectedResult: Rule 'Duplicate Engineering Rule' is listed as active with the updated conditions showing no conflicts

postconditions: No conflicting routing rules exist in the system
Modified rule is saved and active in ApprovalRoutingRules table
System maintains data integrity with conflict-free routing rules
Validation error is logged in system logs

testCases.title: Ensure routing rules apply correctly to sample requests
preconditions: User is logged in as System Administrator
At least two active routing rules exist with different conditions
Test feature for routing rules is available and functional
Sample schedule change request templates are available

steps.action: Navigate to Routing Rules Management page and locate the 'Test Routing Rules' section
steps.expectedResult: Test section displays with option to input sample request parameters

steps.action: Click 'Create Sample Request' button to open the test request form
steps.expectedResult: Sample request form opens with fields for Department, Request Type, Schedule Type, and Request Size

steps.action: Enter sample request parameters: Department='Engineering', Request Type='Shift Swap', Schedule Type='Full-time', Request Size='Single'
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept input and display the entered values correctly

steps.action: Click 'Test Routing' button to apply routing rules to the sample request
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request within 1 second and displays results showing matched routing rule and assigned approvers list

steps.action: Verify the displayed approvers match the expected routing rule configuration
steps.expectedResult: Approvers displayed are 'John Smith' and 'Jane Doe' as configured in the matching rule for Engineering Shift Swap requests

steps.action: Modify sample request parameters to Department='Sales', Request Type='Time Off', keeping other fields the same
steps.expectedResult: Form updates with new parameter values

steps.action: Click 'Test Routing' button again to retest with modified parameters
steps.expectedResult: System processes the updated request and displays different routing results showing new matched rule and different approvers list

steps.action: Verify the routing results updated correctly based on the modified parameters
steps.expectedResult: Approvers displayed are 'Sarah Johnson' matching the Sales department routing rule, confirming rules apply dynamically based on request parameters

postconditions: Test results are displayed accurately without affecting production data
No actual approval requests are created during testing
System performance meets the 1-second rule evaluation requirement
Test activity is logged for audit purposes

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to escalate pending schedule change approvals to achieve timely decision making

testCases.title: Validate automatic escalation of pending approvals
preconditions: Escalation rules are configured with time threshold set to 2 hours
At least one backup approver is designated in the system
Escalation service is running and operational
User has permissions to create schedule change requests
Email notification service is configured and functional

steps.action: Log in as a regular employee and navigate to Schedule Change Request page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule Change Request form loads successfully

steps.action: Create a new schedule change request with valid details: Request Type='Shift Swap', Date='Next Monday', Reason='Personal appointment'
steps.expectedResult: Request is submitted successfully and routed to primary approver 'Manager A' with status 'Pending Approval'

steps.action: Verify the request appears in the primary approver's pending queue without taking any action
steps.expectedResult: Request is visible in Manager A's approval queue with timestamp showing submission time and status 'Pending'

steps.action: Wait for the configured escalation threshold time (2 hours) to elapse without approval action
steps.expectedResult: Request remains in 'Pending Approval' status throughout the waiting period with no status changes

steps.action: Monitor the system for escalation processing after threshold time has passed
steps.expectedResult: Escalation service detects the pending request exceeding threshold and triggers automatic escalation within 1 minute

steps.action: Check the request status in the system after escalation processing
steps.expectedResult: Request status updates to 'Escalated' and backup approver 'Manager B' is now assigned as additional approver

steps.action: Log in as the backup approver and check the notification inbox
steps.expectedResult: Escalation notification is received with subject 'Escalated Approval Required' containing request details and escalation reason

steps.action: Verify the escalated request appears in backup approver's pending queue
steps.expectedResult: Request is visible in Manager B's approval queue with escalation indicator and original submission timestamp

postconditions: Request status is updated to 'Escalated' in ApprovalActions table
Backup approver has access to approve the escalated request
Escalation notification is delivered successfully
Original approver still retains ability to approve the request
Escalation event is logged with timestamp

testCases.title: Verify escalation logging and status tracking
preconditions: User is logged in with administrator or approver role
At least one schedule change request exists that is eligible for escalation
Escalation monitoring UI is accessible
EscalationRules table contains active escalation configuration
System logging is enabled and functional

steps.action: Create or identify a schedule change request that has exceeded the escalation threshold
steps.expectedResult: Request is in pending status beyond the configured threshold time

steps.action: Allow the escalation service to process and trigger escalation for the pending request
steps.expectedResult: Escalation is triggered automatically and request status changes to 'Escalated'

steps.action: Navigate to System Logs or Escalation Logs section in the admin panel
steps.expectedResult: Escalation logs page loads displaying list of escalation events

steps.action: Search for the escalation log entry corresponding to the triggered escalation using request ID
steps.expectedResult: Log entry is found showing escalation action with timestamp, original approver 'Manager A', backup approver 'Manager B', and escalation reason 'Threshold exceeded: 2 hours'

steps.action: Verify all required details are captured in the log entry
steps.expectedResult: Log contains Request ID, Original Approver ID, Backup Approver ID, Escalation Timestamp (accurate to the minute), Threshold Value, and System User ID who configured the rule

steps.action: Navigate to Escalation Monitoring UI from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Escalation monitoring dashboard loads displaying active and historical escalations

steps.action: Locate the escalated request in the monitoring interface
steps.expectedResult: Request appears in the escalations list with status 'Escalated - Pending Backup Approval'

steps.action: Click on the escalated request to view detailed escalation status
steps.expectedResult: Detailed view displays showing escalation timeline, original submission time, escalation trigger time, current status, assigned backup approver, and notification delivery status

steps.action: Verify the escalation status accuracy by comparing with system logs
steps.expectedResult: All information in monitoring UI matches the logged escalation data including timestamps and user details

postconditions: Escalation action is permanently logged in system audit trail
Escalation status is accurately reflected in monitoring UI
Log entries are immutable and timestamped correctly
Authorized users can access escalation history for reporting
Data integrity is maintained across ApprovalActions and EscalationRules tables

testCases.title: Ensure escalation processing meets performance requirements
preconditions: Performance testing environment is configured
Multiple schedule change requests can be created simultaneously
Escalation threshold is set to a testable value (e.g., 5 minutes for testing)
System monitoring tools are available to measure processing time
Notification service has capacity for multiple simultaneous notifications
At least 10 backup approvers are configured in the system

steps.action: Create 10 schedule change requests simultaneously from different users, all requiring approval
steps.expectedResult: All 10 requests are submitted successfully and routed to their respective primary approvers with status 'Pending Approval'

steps.action: Record the exact timestamp when each request was submitted
steps.expectedResult: Submission timestamps are captured accurately for all 10 requests

steps.action: Wait for the escalation threshold time to elapse without any approval actions on the requests
steps.expectedResult: All 10 requests remain in 'Pending Approval' status throughout the threshold period

steps.action: Monitor the escalation service processing using system monitoring tools as threshold is breached
steps.expectedResult: Escalation service detects all 10 pending requests that exceeded threshold

steps.action: Measure the time taken from threshold breach to escalation completion for each request
steps.expectedResult: All 10 requests are escalated within 1 minute of their respective threshold breach times, meeting the performance requirement

steps.action: Verify escalation status updates in the database for all 10 requests
steps.expectedResult: All requests show status 'Escalated' in ApprovalActions table with accurate escalation timestamps

steps.action: Check notification delivery logs to verify when escalation notifications were sent
steps.expectedResult: All 10 escalation notifications were queued for delivery within the 1-minute processing window

steps.action: Log in as each of the 10 backup approvers and verify notification receipt
steps.expectedResult: All backup approvers received their respective escalation notifications within the defined SLA (95% within 2 minutes)

steps.action: Verify system performance metrics during escalation processing
steps.expectedResult: System CPU and memory usage remained within acceptable limits, no performance degradation observed, and all escalations processed concurrently without delays

steps.action: Review escalation logs to confirm all processing times meet the 1-minute requirement
steps.expectedResult: Log analysis shows 100% of escalations (10 out of 10) were processed within 1 minute of threshold breach, confirming performance requirement compliance

postconditions: All 10 requests are in 'Escalated' status
Performance metrics confirm 1-minute processing requirement is met
All escalation notifications are delivered within SLA
System performance remains stable under concurrent escalation load
Escalation logs contain accurate timing data for all requests
No escalation processing errors or timeouts occurred

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to request additional information on schedule change requests to achieve informed approvals

testCases.title: Validate approver can request additional information
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
Approver has permission to access schedule change requests
Notification system is configured and operational
Requester user account is active and has valid contact information

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change requests dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays with list of pending schedule change requests

steps.action: Select and open a pending schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying all request information including requester name, schedule details, reason for change, and current status

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Request More Info' button
steps.expectedResult: A comment entry dialog or form appears with a mandatory text field for entering comments

steps.action: Enter detailed comments explaining what additional information is needed (e.g., 'Please provide justification for the extended hours and manager approval')
steps.expectedResult: Comments are entered successfully in the text field with character count visible if applicable

steps.action: Click 'Submit' or 'Send Request' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays a confirmation message indicating the information request has been submitted successfully

steps.action: Verify the request status has changed to 'Info Requested' or similar status
steps.expectedResult: Request status is updated and displayed on the request details page

steps.action: Check the notification system or requester's notification inbox
steps.expectedResult: Notification is sent to the requester containing the approver's comments and a link to respond to the information request

steps.action: Verify the info request appears in the request history or activity log
steps.expectedResult: Info request action is visible with timestamp, approver name, and comments entered

postconditions: Schedule change request status is updated to 'Info Requested'
Requester has received notification about the information request
Info request is logged in the system audit trail
Approver can view the pending info request status
Request remains in approver's pending queue until additional information is provided

testCases.title: Verify requester can submit additional information
preconditions: User is logged in with Schedule Coordinator (Requester) role
An information request has been submitted by an Approver for one of the requester's schedule change requests
Notification has been sent to the requester about the info request
Requester has access to the schedule change request system
Additional information or documentation is prepared for submission

steps.action: Log in to the system as Schedule Coordinator
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and is directed to the dashboard

steps.action: Check the notifications panel or inbox
steps.expectedResult: Notification about the information request is visible, showing the approver's name, request ID, and comments

steps.action: Click on the notification to open the associated schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens showing the original request details and the approver's information request with comments

steps.action: Locate the 'Respond to Info Request' or 'Submit Additional Information' section
steps.expectedResult: A response form or text area is displayed for entering additional information

steps.action: Enter the additional information requested by the approver (e.g., 'Manager approval attached. Extended hours needed due to project deadline on March 15th')
steps.expectedResult: Information is entered successfully in the response field

steps.action: Attach any supporting documents if applicable
steps.expectedResult: Documents are uploaded and attached to the response

steps.action: Click 'Submit' or 'Send Response' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message that additional information has been submitted successfully

steps.action: Verify the request status changes to 'Pending Approval' or 'Under Review'
steps.expectedResult: Request status is updated indicating the additional information has been provided

steps.action: Log in as the Approver who requested the information
steps.expectedResult: Approver successfully logs in to the system

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change request that had the info request
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens

steps.action: Review the request details and locate the additional information section
steps.expectedResult: Additional information submitted by the requester is visible and clearly linked to the original info request, including any attached documents

steps.action: Verify timestamp and requester name are displayed with the additional information
steps.expectedResult: Submission details show when the information was provided and by whom

postconditions: Additional information is saved and linked to the original schedule change request
Request status is updated to reflect that information has been provided
Approver can view the additional information and proceed with approval decision
Response action is logged in the audit trail
Notification may be sent to approver about the response (system dependent)

testCases.title: Ensure all info request actions are logged

User has Requester role access to submit additional information

Audit logging system is enabled and functioning
User has permission to view audit logs or activity history

steps.action: Log in as Approver
steps.expectedResult: Approver successfully logs in to the system

steps.action: Open a pending schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Request details page is displayed

steps.action: Click 'Request More Info' button and enter comments 'Need clarification on shift timing'
steps.expectedResult: Comment entry form is displayed and comments are entered

steps.action: Submit the information request
steps.expectedResult: System confirms the info request has been submitted

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log or activity history section of the request
steps.expectedResult: Audit log page or section is displayed

steps.action: Locate the most recent entry for the information request action
steps.expectedResult: Log entry exists showing: Action type 'Information Requested', Approver username, Timestamp (date and time), Comments entered, Request ID

steps.action: Verify all required fields are captured in the log entry
steps.expectedResult: Log entry contains complete information including user ID, action type, timestamp, and associated comments

steps.action: Log out and log in as Schedule Coordinator (Requester)
steps.expectedResult: Requester successfully logs in to the system

steps.action: Open the schedule change request with the info request
steps.expectedResult: Request details page displays with the information request visible

steps.action: Submit additional information in response to the info request (e.g., 'Shift timing is 2 PM to 10 PM as per department needs')

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log or activity history section
steps.expectedResult: Audit log page or section is displayed

steps.action: Locate the log entry for the additional information submission

steps.action: Verify the chronological order of log entries

steps.action: Verify log entries are immutable and cannot be edited or deleted

postconditions: All information request actions are permanently logged in the audit trail
Log entries include complete details: user, timestamp, action type, and content
